org.apache.juneau.serializer.annotation

Annotation Type SerializerConfig


  • @Documented
 @Target(value={TYPE,METHOD})
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Inherited
 @PropertyStoreApply(value=SerializerConfigApply.class)
public @interface SerializerConfig
    Annotation for specifying config properties defined in Serializer, OutputStreamSerializer, and WriterSerializer.

    Used primarily for specifying bean configuration properties on REST classes and methods.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      String addBeanTypes
      Configuration property: Add "_type" properties when needed.
      String addRootType
      Configuration property: Add type attribute to root nodes.
      String binaryFormat
      Configuration property: Binary output format.
      String fileCharset
      Configuration property: File charset.
      Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener
      Configuration property: Serializer listener.
      String maxIndent
      Configuration property: Maximum indentation.
      String quoteChar
      Configuration property: Quote character.
      String sortCollections
      Configuration property: Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.
      String sortMaps
      Configuration property: Sort maps alphabetically.
      String streamCharset
      Configuration property: Output stream charset.
      String trimEmptyCollections
      Configuration property: Trim empty lists and arrays.
      String trimEmptyMaps
      Configuration property: Trim empty maps.
      String trimNullProperties
      Configuration property: Trim null bean property values.
      String trimStrings
      Configuration property: Trim strings.
      String uriContext
      Configuration property: URI context bean.
      String uriRelativity
      Configuration property: URI relativity.
      String uriResolution
      Configuration property: URI resolution.
      String useWhitespace
      Configuration property: Use whitespace.

    • Element Detail

      • binaryFormat

        public abstract String binaryFormat
        Configuration property: Binary output format.

        When using the Serializer.serializeToString(Object) method on stream-based serializers, this defines the format to use when converting the resulting byte array to a string.

        • Possible values:
          • "SPACED_HEX"
          • "HEX" (default)
          • "BASE64"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "OutputStreamSerializer.binaryFormat.s".
        • OutputStreamSerializer.OSSERIALIZER_binaryFormat
        Default:
        ""

      • addBeanTypes

        public abstract String addBeanTypes
        Configuration property: Add "_type" properties when needed.

        If "true", then "_type" properties will be added to beans if their type cannot be inferred through reflection.

        This is used to recreate the correct objects during parsing if the object types cannot be inferred.
        For example, when serializing a Map<String,Object> field where the bean class cannot be determined from the type of the values.

        Note the differences between the following settings:

        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addRootType - Affects whether '_type' is added to root node.
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addBeanTypes - Affects whether '_type' is added to any nodes.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.addBeanTypes.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addBeanTypes
        Default:
        ""

      • addRootType

        public abstract String addRootType
        Configuration property: Add type attribute to root nodes.

        When disabled, it is assumed that the parser knows the exact Java POJO type being parsed, and therefore top-level type information that might normally be included to determine the data type will not be serialized.

        For example, when serializing a top-level POJO with a @Bean(typeName) value, a '_type' attribute will only be added when this setting is enabled.

        Note the differences between the following settings:

        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addRootType - Affects whether '_type' is added to root node.
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addBeanTypes - Affects whether '_type' is added to any nodes.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.addRootType.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_addRootType
        Default:
        ""

      • listener

        public abstract Class<? extends SerializerListener> listener
        Configuration property: Serializer listener.

        Class used to listen for errors and warnings that occur during serialization.

        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_listener
        Default:
        org.apache.juneau.serializer.SerializerListener.Null.class

      • sortCollections

        public abstract String sortCollections
        Configuration property: Sort arrays and collections alphabetically.

        Copies and sorts the contents of arrays and collections before serializing them.

        Note that this introduces a performance penalty.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.sortCollections.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_sortCollections
        Default:
        ""

      • sortMaps

        public abstract String sortMaps
        Configuration property: Sort maps alphabetically.

        Copies and sorts the contents of maps by their keys before serializing them.

        Note that this introduces a performance penalty.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.sortMaps.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_sortMaps
        Default:
        ""

      • trimEmptyCollections

        public abstract String trimEmptyCollections
        Configuration property: Trim empty lists and arrays.

        If "true", empty lists and arrays will not be serialized.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Map entries with empty list values will be lost.
        • Bean properties with empty list values will not be set.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.trimEmptyCollections.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_trimEmptyCollections
        Default:
        ""

      • trimEmptyMaps

        public abstract String trimEmptyMaps
        Configuration property: Trim empty maps.

        If "true", empty map values will not be serialized to the output.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Bean properties with empty map values will not be set.
        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.trimEmptyMaps.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_trimEmptyMaps
        Default:
        ""

      • trimNullProperties

        public abstract String trimNullProperties
        Configuration property: Trim null bean property values.

        If "true", null bean values will not be serialized to the output.

        Note that enabling this setting has the following effects on parsing:

        • Map entries with null values will be lost.
        • Possible values:
          • "true" (default)
          • "false"
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.trimNullProperties.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_trimNullProperties
        Default:
        ""

      • trimStrings

        public abstract String trimStrings
        Configuration property: Trim strings.

        If "true", string values will be trimmed of whitespace using String.trim() before being serialized.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.trimStrings.b".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_trimStrings
        Default:
        ""

      • uriContext

        public abstract String uriContext
        Configuration property: URI context bean.
        Description:

        Bean used for resolution of URIs to absolute or root-relative form.

        • Format: JSON object representing a UriContext
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.uriContext.s".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_uriContext
        Default:
        ""

      • uriRelativity

        public abstract String uriRelativity
        Configuration property: URI relativity.

        Defines what relative URIs are relative to when serializing any of the following:

        • URI
        • URL
        • Properties and classes annotated with @URI
        • Possible values:
          • "RESOURCE" (default) - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the servlet URI.
          • "PATH_INFO" - Relative URIs should be considered relative to the request URI.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.uriRelativity.s".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_uriRelativity
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > URIs
        Default:
        ""

      • uriResolution

        public abstract String uriResolution
        Configuration property: URI resolution.

        Defines the resolution level for URIs when serializing any of the following:

        • URI
        • URL
        • Properties and classes annotated with @URI
        • Possible values:
          • "ABSOLUTE" - Resolve to an absolute URL (e.g. "http://host:port/context-root/servlet-path/path-info").
          • "ROOT_RELATIVE" - Resolve to a root-relative URL (e.g. "/context-root/servlet-path/path-info").
          • "NONE" (default) - Don't do any URL resolution.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.uriResolution.s".
        • Serializer.SERIALIZER_uriResolution
        • Overview > juneau-marshall > URIs
        Default:
        ""

      • fileCharset

        public abstract String fileCharset
        Configuration property: File charset.

        The character set to use for writing Files to the file system.

        Used when passing in files to Serializer.serialize(Object, Object).

        • Format: string
        • "DEFAULT" can be used to indicate the JVM default file system charset.
        • Default: JVM system default.
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "WriterSerializer.fileCharset.s".
        • This setting does not apply to the RDF serializers.
        • WriterSerializer.WSERIALIZER_fileCharset
        Default:
        ""

      • maxIndent

        public abstract String maxIndent
        Configuration property: Maximum indentation.

        Specifies the maximum indentation level in the serialized document.

        • Format: integer
        • Default: 100
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "WriterSerializer.maxIndent.i".
        • This setting does not apply to the RDF serializers.
        • WriterSerializer.WSERIALIZER_maxIndent
        Default:
        ""

      • quoteChar

        public abstract String quoteChar
        Configuration property: Quote character.

        This is the character used for quoting attributes and values.

        • Default: "
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "WriterSerializer.quoteChar.s".
        • This setting does not apply to the RDF serializers.
        • WriterSerializer.WSERIALIZER_quoteChar
        Default:
        ""

      • streamCharset

        public abstract String streamCharset
        Configuration property: Output stream charset.

        The character set to use when writing to OutputStreams.

        Used when passing in output streams and byte arrays to Serializer.serialize(Object, Object).

        • Format: string
        • Default: "utf-8".
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "WriterSerializer.streamCharset.s".
        • This setting does not apply to the RDF serializers.
        • WriterSerializer.WSERIALIZER_streamCharset
        Default:
        ""

      • useWhitespace

        public abstract String useWhitespace
        Configuration property: Use whitespace.

        If "true", whitespace is added to the output to improve readability.

        • Possible values:
          • "true"
          • "false" (default)
        • Supports Default SVL Variables (e.g. "$C{myConfigVar}").
        • A default global value can be set via the system property "Serializer.useWhitespace.b".
        • WriterSerializer.WSERIALIZER_useWhitespace
        Default:
        ""
